i1.blurb: After Lee Sin uses an ability, his next 2 basic attacks gain 40% Attack Speed and return 20/10 Energy.
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} After using an ability, '''Lee Sin's''' next 2 [[basic attack]]s within 3 seconds gain {{sti|attack speed|{{as|40% '''bonus''' attack speed}}}}, returning {{tip|energy|{{as|{{pp|3|20 to 40|1 to 13}} energy}}}} on the first attack and {{ft|half of that|{{sti|energy|{{as|{{pp|3|10 to 20|1 to 13}} energy}}}}}} on the second.
i1.name: Flurry
notes: * ''Flurry'' does not activate when using summoner spells or activating items.

* ''Flurry'' will still restore energy even if the attacks are {{ai|Counter Strike|Jax|dodged}}, {{ai|Riposte|Fiora|parried}}, {{ai|Aegis Protection|Pantheon|blocked}}, or if ''Lee Sin'' is {{tip|blind|blinded}}.

q1.blurb: Lee Sin projects a discordant wave of sound to locate his enemies, dealing physical damage to the first enemy it encounters. If Sonic Wave hits, Lee Sin can cast Resonating Strike for the next 3 seconds.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' fires a sonic blast in the target direction, dealing {{tip|physical damage}} to the first enemy it hits and granting {{tip|true sight}} of them for 3 seconds.
If ''Sonic Wave'' hits, '''Lee Sin''' can cast {{ai|Resonating Strike|Lee Sin}} within the next 3 seconds.
q1.name: Sonic Wave
notes: * ''Sonic Wave's'' {{tip|true sight}} is consumed when ''Lee Sin'' casts ''Resonating Strike''.

q2.blurb: Lee Sin dashes to the enemy hit by Sonic Wave, dealing physical damage.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' {{tip|dashes}} to the enemy marked by {{ai|Sonic Wave|Lee Sin}}, placing himself on top of the target and dealing {{as|physical damage}}, increased by {{as|{{pp|11|key=%|type=target's '''missing''' health|0 to 100|0 to 100|key1=%|displayformula=1% per 1% of target's '''missing''' health}}|health}}.
leveling: {{st|Physical Damage|{{ap|50 to 150}} {{as|(+ 100% '''bonus''' AD)}}|Maximum Damage|{{ap|50*2 to 150*2}} {{as|(+ 200% '''bonus''' AD)}}}}
q2.name: Resonating Strike
notes: * ''Lee Sin'' will travel to ''Resonating Strike's'' target last location if they die while he is mid-dash.

w1.blurb: Lee Sin rushes to target ally, shielding himself from damage. If the ally is a champion, they are also shielded. After using Safeguard, Lee Sin can cast Iron Will for the next 3 seconds.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' {{tip|dashes}} to the target ally or friendly {{ccib|Support icon.png|ward}}. If the ally is a champion, both they and '''Lee Sin''' are {{tip|shield|shielded}} for 2 seconds and ''Safeguard's'' {{sti|cooldown}} is reduced by 50%. '''Lee Sin''' can self-cast ''Safeguard'' to shield himself.
If ''Safeguard'' is used, '''Lee Sin''' can cast {{ai|Iron Will|Lee Sin}} within 3 seconds.
w1.name: Safeguard
notes: * ''Lee Sin'' cannot self-cast ''Safeguard'' if he is immobilized.

* ''Safeguard'' can be used on any targetable allied unit (champions, minions, wards, {{ai|Demacian Standard|Jarvan IV}}, {{ai|Noxious Trap|Teemo}}, {{ai|Dark Passage|Thresh|Lantern}}) except towers and inhibitors.
* Casting ''Safeguard'' will interrupt {{ais|Resonating Strike|Lee Sin}} dash, preventing any potential damage.

w2.blurb: Lee Sin's intense training allows him to thrive in battle. For 4 seconds, Lee Sin gains Life Steal and Spell Vamp.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} For 4 seconds, '''Lee Sin''' gains {{sti|'''bonus''' life steal}} and {{sti|'''bonus''' spell vamp}}.
w2.name: Iron Will

e1.blurb: Lee Sin smashes the ground, sending out a shockwave that deals magic damage and reveals enemy units hit. If Tempest hits an enemy, Lee Sin can cast cripple for the next 3 seconds.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' smashes the ground, dealing {{as|magic damage}} to nearby enemies and granting {{tip|sight}} of them for 4 seconds.
If ''Tempest'' hits an enemy, '''Lee Sin''' can cast {{ai|Cripple|Lee Sin}} within the next 3 seconds.
e1.name: Tempest
notes: * ''Tempest's'' {{tip|sight}} is not removed when ''Lee Sin'' casts ''Cripple'' (unlike {{ais|Sonic Wave|Lee Sin}}).

e2.blurb: Lee Sin cripples nearby enemies damaged by Tempest, reducing their Movement Speed for 4 seconds. Movement Speed recovers gradually over the duration.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' {{tip|slow|slows}} all enemies in range and marked by {{ai|Tempest|Lee Sin}} for 4 seconds, decaying over the duration.
e2.name: Cripple
notes: * ''Tempest's'' {{tip|sight}} is not removed when ''Lee Sin'' casts ''Cripple'' (unlike {{ais|Sonic Wave|Lee Sin}}).

r1.blurb: Lee Sin performs a powerful roundhouse kick launching his target back, dealing physical damage to the target and any enemies they collide with. Enemies the target collides with are knocked into the air for a short duration. This technique was taught to him by Jesse Perring, although Lee Sin does not kick players off the map.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Lee Sin''' instantly {{tip|root|roots}} the target enemy champion for {{tt|{{fd|0.25}}|Estimated}} seconds after which he roundhouse kicks them dealing {{as|physical damage}} and {{tip|airborne|knocking them back}} 1200 units over 1 second.
Enemies hit by the displaced enemy receive {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} and are {{tip|airborne|knocked up}} for 1 second.
leveling: {{st|Collision Damage|{{ap|150 to 600}} {{as|(+ 200% '''bonus''' AD)}} {{as|(+ {{ap|12 to 18}}% of kicked target's '''bonus''' health)}}}}
r1.name: Dragon's Rage
notes: * If ''Dragon's Rage's'' target dies when first hit there will be no displacement of any kind.

** The {{tip|airborne|displacement's}} direction is decided at the moment of impact and not by ''Lee Sin'' and his target's relative locations on-cast (the only way for ''Lee Sin'' to control where his target is displaced is by using {{si|Flash}} before ''Dragon's Rage's'' cast time ends).
* ''Dragon's Rage'' applies {{tip|single target}} spell effect to the main target and {{tip|area of effect}} to enemies hit by the main-target-projectile.
* The ability will go on cooldown after dealing its damage.
** Because of this, if {{ri|Electrocute}} procs from the root and kills the enemy the ability will not go on cooldown.
